intro: Micromeria graeca subsp. fruticulosa, commonly known as Greek micromeria, is a flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is a shrub-like perennial that typically grows in rocky or arid environments. The plant features small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, and its leaves are finely divided and aromatic. It is native to the Mediterranean region, particularly Greece and Turkey. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
